Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "Nonlinear and Modern Mathematical Physics" that will be held in Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), from May 4-8 2017.

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of mathematical physics and partial differential equations. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at: http://einspem.upm.edu.my/nmmp2017/index.html

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 4th NMMP Workshop:

Conference Time:  4-8 May, 2017      Conference Venue: Dorsett, Putrajaya, Malaysia

The 4th International Workshop on Nonlinear and Modern Mathematical Physics (NMMP) co-organized by Universiti Putra Malaysia and University of South Florida, held from 4-8 May, 2017, was tremendously successful.

The global organizing committee, consisting of Dr. Wenxiu Ma (University of South Florida) as co-chairman, Dr. Adem Kilicman (Universiti Putra Malaysia) as co-chairman, and Dr. Masood Khalique (North-West University, South Africa), worked with selection of workshop topics, hotel accommodation and schedule of talks during the preparation phase, while the offices of Institute for Mathematical Research provided staff support throughout the workshop.

The workshop had 43 speakers and 106 participants from 12 countries of Europe, Asia, America and Africa. We invited tewelve (3 keynote and 9 invited speakers) world-renowned mathematicians and physicists to give plenary speeches at this workshop. Their speeches provided general tutorials which would immediately help young participants including graduate students and new PhDs to explore this beautiful world of nonlinear mathematical physics.

This workshop was made possible by an award from the National Science Foundation, Division of Mathematical Sciences, and the generous support from the Office of Institute of Mathematical Research and Malaysian Mathematical Sciences Society. NSF award allowed us to support 10 American speakers and participants for their trip expenses at an average rate of about $2360. Those are all young graduate students and international renowned researchers and speakers with no NSF support.

The selected papers presented at this important international workshop will be published as one volume in the conference proceedings series by the American Institute of Physics to be dsitrbuted to major libraries around the world. Detailed information about this workshop is available at http://einspem.upm.edu.my/nmmp2017/. It is our hope that the workshop series would help us increase outreach efforts to recruit excellent international students and achieve the educational goals of University of South Florida as a major urban research university.
